bugs.title: CVE-2015-0224 qpid-cpp: qpidd can be crashed by unauthenticated user (incomplete fix for CVE-2015-0203) [epel-7]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-0224 qpid-cpp: qpidd can be crashed by unauthenticated user (incomplete fix for CVE-2015-0203) [epel-7]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-0224 qpid-cpp: AMQP 0-10 protocol sequence-set maximal range DoS (incomplete CVE-2015-0203 fix)

long_desc.thetext:
In CVE-2015-0203 it was announced that certain unexpected protocol sequences cause the broker process to crash due to insufficient checking, but that authentication could be used to restrict the exploitation of this vulnerability.

It has now been discovered that in fact failing authentication does not necessarily prevent exploitation of those reported vulnerabilities.

Further, it was stated that one of the specific vulnerabilities was that the qpidd broker can be crashed by sending it a sequence-set containing an invalid range, where the start of the range is after the end. This was an incorrect analysis of the vulnerability, which is in fact caused by a sequence-set containing a single range expressing the maximum possible gap.

A further patch is available that handles a range expressing the maximum possible gap without assertion (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/QPID-6310). The fix will be included in subsequent releases, but can be applied to 0.30 if desired.

Created qpid-cpp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1186304]

Created qpid-cpp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1186305]

Upstream advisory from which comment 0 quotes:

http://seclists.org/bugtraq/2015/Jan/121

This issue is related to previously announced CVE-2015-0203, see bug 1181721 comment 3.

Upstream bug and commit:

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/QPID-6310
https://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1654365

Via RHSA-2015:0707 https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-0707.html

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  MRG Messaging v.3 for RHEL-7

Via RHSA-2015:0708 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015:0708

Via RHSA-2015:0708 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015:0708

The qpid-cpp packages in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 are deprecated, see bug 1181721 comment 11.

bugs.title: CVE-2015-0223 qpid-cpp: anonymous access to qpidd cannot be prevented [epel-7]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-0223 qpid-cpp: anonymous access to qpidd cannot be prevented [epel-7]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-0223 qpid-cpp: anonymous access to qpidd cannot be prevented

long_desc.thetext:
It was reported [1] that an attacker can gain access to qpidd as an anonymous user, even if the ANONYMOUS mechanism is disallowed.

A patch is available (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/QPID-6325)
that addresses this vulnerability. The fix will be included in
subsequent releases, but can be applied to 0.30 if desired.

[1]: http://seclists.org/bugtraq/2015/Jan/122

Created qpid-cpp tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1186310]
Affects: epel-7 [bug 1186311]

bugs.title: qpidd ends up in symbol lookup error

bugzilla.short_desc: qpidd ends up in symbol lookup error

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
qpidd: /usr/sbin/qpidd: symbol lookup error: /lib64/libqpidbroker.so.2: undefined symbol: _ZN4qpid3sys4Path9separatorE

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
qpid-cpp-server-0.34-4.el7.x86_64

How reproducible:
everytime

Steps to Reproduce:
1.install qpid-cpp-server
2.
3.

Actual results:
[root@anyhost ~]# /usr/sbin/qpidd
/usr/sbin/qpidd: symbol lookup error: /lib64/libqpidbroker.so.2: undefined symbol: _ZN4qpid3sys4Path9separatorE


Expected results:
works 

Additional info:

[root@anyhost ~]# yum list installed | grep qpid
compat-qpid-cpp-client.x86_64      0.24-19.el7                    @epel         
python-gofer-qpid.noarch           2.6.6-1.el7                    @pulp-2-stable
python-qpid.noarch                 0.32-9.el7                     @epel         
python-qpid-common.noarch          0.32-9.el7                     @epel         
python-qpid-qmf.x86_64             0.32-1.el7                     @epel         
qpid-cpp-server.x86_64             0.34-4.el7                     @epel         
qpid-cpp-server-linearstore.x86_64 0.34-4.el7                     @epel         
qpid-proton-c.x86_64               0.10-2.el7                     @epel         
qpid-qmf.x86_64                    0.32-1.el7                     @epel         
qpid-tools.noarch                  0.32-9.el7                     @epel

Bodhi update https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2015-40795af09d should be linked to this bug, not https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1286881

Related to that, a testing build is available in epel-testing; this bug should be ON_QA.
